text:
Tom Hardy's wife Charlotte Riley says film industry needs to be more family friendly 
Riley said she and Hardy have to rely on a childcare “support network” Tuesday 7 February 2017 10:43 GMT Click to followES Entertainment Parents act: Charlotte Riley and Tom Hardy Dave Benett 
Charlotte Riley has revealed she and her actor husband Tom Hardy have to rely on a childcare “support network” of relatives and friends as she called for the film industry to become more family friendly. 
The Close To The Enemy and Peaky Blinders actress said that even with a supportive partner women’s careers tend to suffer more from having to juggle parenting with working long and unsociable hours. 
Riley, 35, who has a 15-month-old toddler with Batman star Hardy, 39, said: “Like most people we rely on family and friends for help with childcare, but that isn’t even a choice for a lot of people. 
“Talking to women within the industry who love children and want to have children, some of them have found it incompatible to have children and a career. (Jason Merritt/Getty ) 
“Anyone bringing children into the world has to think about the work/life balance, but being a mother is part of who I am now. I bring that into my work. It shouldn’t have to be one or the other.” 
The actress, who will next be seen as the Duchess of Cambridge in the BBC adaptation of hit play King Charles III, was today named as an ambassador for the Raising Films campaign to promote better working conditions for parents and carers within film and TV. Read more
